required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Noninterventional Study in Bipolar Disorder and Schizophrenia With Zeldox
clinical_study.official_title: Noninterventional Study (NIS) in Patients With Bipolar Disorder (Manic or Mixed Episodes) and Schizophrenia Undergoing Treatment With Zeldox

brief_summary.textblock: Investigation of the impact of Zeldox on metabolic parameters in patients with bipolar disorder or with schizophrenia and the impact of the treatment with quality of life.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Manic and mixed episodes of up to moderate severity in patients with type I and II bipolar disorder and schizophrenia; either first diagnosed or repeated episodes.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a history of hypersensitivity to Ziprasidone.
- Previous insufficiency of the Ziprasidone´s treatment.
- The break of the previous therapeutic condition.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects enrolled had to have taken at least 1 dose of 40, 60, or 80 milligrams of ziprasidone. The study included subjects with diagnosed Type I or II bipolar disorder with manic and mixed episodes (n=223) and subjects with schizophrenia of up to moderate severity, either first diagnosed or repeated episodes (n=248).

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Subjects had to have taken at least 1 dose of ziprasidone 40, 60, or 80 milligrams

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Subjects had to have taken at least 1 dose of ziprasidone 40, 60, or 80 milligrams

measure.title: Age, Customized
Gender, Customized

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S) Scores (Bipolar Population)
outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the condition at baseline using a scale that ranges from (1)Normal, not ill at all to (7) Among the most severely ill patients.
outcome.population: The bipolar full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of bipolar mania who had received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Subjects had to have taken at least 1 dose of ziprasidone 40, 60, or 80 milligrams

measure.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the condition at baseline using a scale that ranges from (1)Normal, not ill at all to (7) Among the most severely ill patients.
measure.population: The bipolar full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of bipolar mania who had received at least 1 dose of study medication.

class.title: (7) Among the most extremely ill subjects

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S) Scores (Schizophrenia Population)

outcome.population: The schizophrenia full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of schizophrenia who had received at least 1 dose of study medication

measure.title: Clinical Global Impression of Severity (CGI-S) Scores (Schizophrenia Population)

measure.population: The schizophrenia full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of schizophrenia who had received at least 1 dose of study medication

class.title: (7) Among the most severely ill subjects

outcome.title: Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) Scores (Bipolar Population): Change From Baseline
outcome.description: The YMRS is an 11-item questionnaire that rates the severity of bipolar disorder, with higher score indicating greater severity of disease. Change: score at final visit minus score at baseline.
outcome.population: The bipolar full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of bipolar mania who had received at least 1 dose of study medication. If the final visit measurement was missing, the follow-up measurement could be carried forward. If any individual item was missing, the total score was set to missing.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Subjects had to have taken at least 1 dose of ziprasidone 40, 60, or 80 milligrams

measure.title: Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) Scores (Bipolar Population): Change From Baseline
measure.description: The YMRS is an 11-item questionnaire that rates the severity of bipolar disorder, with higher score indicating greater severity of disease. Change: score at final visit minus score at baseline.
measure.population: The bipolar full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of bipolar mania who had received at least 1 dose of study medication. If the final visit measurement was missing, the follow-up measurement could be carried forward. If any individual item was missing, the total score was set to missing.

outcome.title: Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Scores (Bipolar Population): Change From Baseline
outcome.description: MADRS measures treatment effect on depression severity. MADRS assesses apparent and reported sadness, inner tension, sleep, appetite, concentration difficulties, lassitude, inability to feel, pessimistic thoughts, and suicidal thoughts. Higher score indicates greater severity of disease. Change: score at final visit minus score at baseline.
outcome.population: The bipolar full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of bipolar mania who had received at least 1 dose of study medication. If any individual item was missing, the total score was set to missing.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Subjects had to have taken at least 1 dose of ziprasidone 40, 60, or 80 milligrams

measure.title: Montgomery Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Scores (Bipolar Population): Change From Baseline
measure.description: MADRS measures treatment effect on depression severity. MADRS assesses apparent and reported sadness, inner tension, sleep, appetite, concentration difficulties, lassitude, inability to feel, pessimistic thoughts, and suicidal thoughts. Higher score indicates greater severity of disease. Change: score at final visit minus score at baseline.
measure.population: The bipolar full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of bipolar mania who had received at least 1 dose of study medication. If any individual item was missing, the total score was set to missing.

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impressions Change (CGI-C) Scores (Bipolar Population)
outcome.description: CGI-C assesses change in severity of the condition using a scale that ranges from (1) very much improved to (7) very much worse. Higher score indicates increasing severity of disease.
outcome.population: The bipolar full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of bipolar mania who had received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Subjects had to have taken at least 1 dose of ziprasidone 40, 60, or 80 milligrams

measure.title: Clinical Global Impressions Change (CGI-C) Scores (Bipolar Population)
measure.description: CGI-C assesses change in severity of the condition using a scale that ranges from (1) very much improved to (7) very much worse. Higher score indicates increasing severity of disease.
measure.population: The bipolar full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of bipolar mania who had received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impressions Change (CGI-C) Scores (Schizoprenia Population)
outcome.description: CGI-C assesses change in severity of the condition using a scale that ranges from (1) very much improved to (7) very much worse. Higher score indicates increasing severity of disease.
outcome.population: The schizophrenia full analysis set included all subjects who had been diagnosed with schizophrenia and had received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Subjects had to have taken at least 1 dose of ziprasidone 40, 60, or 80 milligrams

measure.title: Clinical Global Impressions Change (CGI-C) Scores (Schizoprenia Population)
measure.description: CGI-C assesses change in severity of the condition using a scale that ranges from (1) very much improved to (7) very much worse. Higher score indicates increasing severity of disease.
measure.population: The schizophrenia full analysis set included all subjects who had been diagnosed with schizophrenia and had received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS) Scores (Schizophrenia Population): Change From Baseline
outcome.description: BPRS is an 18-item scale with 11 general symptom items, 5 positive-symptom items, and 2 negative symptom items. The physician completes the BPRS, and each item is scored on a 7-point scale, with higher score indicating greater severity of symptom. Change: score at final visit minus score at baseline.
outcome.population: The schizophrenia full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of schizophrenia who had received at least 1 dose of study medication. If any individual item was missing, the total score was set to missing.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Subjects had to have taken at least 1 dose of ziprasidone 40, 60, or 80 milligrams

measure.title: Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS) Scores (Schizophrenia Population): Change From Baseline
measure.description: BPRS is an 18-item scale with 11 general symptom items, 5 positive-symptom items, and 2 negative symptom items. The physician completes the BPRS, and each item is scored on a 7-point scale, with higher score indicating greater severity of symptom. Change: score at final visit minus score at baseline.
measure.population: The schizophrenia full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of schizophrenia who had received at least 1 dose of study medication. If any individual item was missing, the total score was set to missing.

outcome.title: Extrapyramidal Symptom (EPS) Scores (Schizophrenia Population: Baseline and Final Visit
outcome.description: EPS assesses 4 items: akathisia, dystonia, dyskinesia, and parkinsonism. Each item is scored on a 5-point severity scale ranging from 1 to 5, with higher score indicating greater severity of symptom. Change: score at final visit minus score at baseline.
outcome.population: The schizophrenia full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of schizophrenia who had received at least 1 dose of study medication. If any individual item was missing, the total score was set to missing.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Subjects had to have taken at least 1 dose of ziprasidone 40, 60, or 80 milligrams

measure.title: Extrapyramidal Symptom (EPS) Scores (Schizophrenia Population: Baseline and Final Visit
measure.description: EPS assesses 4 items: akathisia, dystonia, dyskinesia, and parkinsonism. Each item is scored on a 5-point severity scale ranging from 1 to 5, with higher score indicating greater severity of symptom. Change: score at final visit minus score at baseline.
measure.population: The schizophrenia full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of schizophrenia who had received at least 1 dose of study medication. If any individual item was missing, the total score was set to missing.

outcome.title: Global Efficacy Evaluation Scores (Bipolar Population)
outcome.description: The Global Efficacy Evaluation assesses the final efficacy of ziprasidone on bipolar symptoms using a 5-point scale that ranges from very good to worsening of the original disease.
outcome.population: The bipolar full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of bipolar mania who had received at least 1 dose of study medication.

group.title: Ziprasidone
group.description: Subjects had to have taken at least 1 dose of ziprasidone 40, 60, or 80 milligrams

measure.population: The bipolar full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of bipolar mania who had received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Manchester Short Assessment of Quality of Life (MANSA) Scores (Bipolar Population) in Answer to: How Satisfied Are You With Your Life as a Whole Today?
outcome.description: MANSA is a 16-item self-assessment of satisfaction with quality of life. Items are rated on a 7-point scale, with higher score indicating greater satisfaction.
outcome.population: The bipolar full analysis set included all subjects with a diagnosis of bipolar mania who had received at least 1 dose of study medication.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: In this noninterventional study, patients received Zeldox in compliance with the Summary of Product Characteristics (SPC) and based solely on therapeutic need. Data were included from 2 patients <18 years; the SPC does not address this age group.
